lexUnit.name: gain.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move up on a scale

sentence.text: In trade-weighted terms the dollar gained 1.4% during the week and the D-mark lost 0.5% .
The DAX index gained 10.87 points to 1,613.27 .
The FT 30 share index gained 20.4 to 1,817.7 .
The yen 's trade-weighted value gained 1.0% during the week .
Bearing in mind that canoeing is gaining in popularity , along with the leisure industry , the situation will get worse before it gets better .
As the new word gained in popularity , military allusions also came thick and fast .
But it has gained amazingly in popularity .

Brought on to lowland pastures in kinder climates , it gains considerably in size though in its own environment it is almost the smallest breed in Britain : only the Shetland and the Dexter of Ireland are shorter .
Paradoxically these works gain in subtlety of gesture and meaning as they gain in size .
Mrs Marcos has gained in stature during her exile .
At the same time they have gained in critical stature as successions of scholars and students around the world have failed to exhaust their interest .
After five years of easy credit , the Fed has reversed course , leaving no doubt about its commitment to fighting inflation in an economy that has finally started to gain momentum .
